summary: The Federal Aviation Administration relies on information systems to help air traffic controllers keep the airspace safe and efficient. However, these systems are aging and experiencing issues. Last year, FAA determined that 51 of its 138 systems are unsustainable. Our testimony highlights that 17 of these unsustainable systems are especially concerning. However, FAA doesn't plan to complete modernization projects for some of these systems for...
title: Air Traffic Control: Urgent FAA Actions Are Needed to Modernize Aging Systems
